summary: Memory usage in TypeScript SDK v1.9.0 grows during load testing (120MB to 300MB) and doesn't decrease after 5-10 minutes. Investigation suggests OperatorSubscriber instances (43,890 found) may be accumulating in the workflow cache without proper cleanup.
userImpact: Workers experience significant memory growth under load, reaching 300MB+ and failing to reclaim memory, impacting production deployments on Kubernetes nodes.
rootCause: Unclear from discussion, but suspected to involve OperatorSubscriber instances accumulating in the workflow cache; maintainer requests reproduction code and heap snapshot analysis.
resolutionDetails: Issue closed by maintainer after author failed to respond to diagnostic requests (provide heap snapshot, workflow count, maxCachedWorkflows setting, or reproduction code).
keyQuote: Your screenshot indicates 43'890 instances of `OperatorSubscriber`. That's certainly a lot, yet could still be legitimate, depending on the number of cached Workflows
